Fantasy adventure set in the 19th century, starring Dakota Blue Richards, Ioan Gruffudd and Tim Curry.(n)

programme.title: The Godfather: Part III
programme.desc: Twenty years after ordering the murder of his brother, ageing don Michael Corleone is close to fulfilling his dream of severing his family's Mafia ties and gaining legitimacy, but vengeful enemies and the actions of his hot-headed nephew soon draw him back into a life of crime. Conclusion of Francis Ford Coppola's crime drama trilogy, starring Al Pacino, Andy Garcia, Diane Keaton, Talia Shire, Eli Wallach, Bridget Fonda and Joe Mantegna.

programme.title: ID2: Shadwell Army
programme.desc: A police officer goes undercover as a football hooligan to bring far-right extremists to justice. Sequel to the 1995 crime thriller, starring Simon Rivers, Linus Roache, Paul Popplewell and Andy Rush.

programme.title: Sam Churchill: Search for a Homeless Man
programme.desc: A seemingly straightforward missing persons case draws a private investigator into a battle against the members of a child pornography ring, who are holding a teenager he has been hired to find. Thriller, starring John Schneider, Robyn Lively, Alex Rocco and Rudy Ramos.

programme.title: Imperium
programme.desc: An undercover FBI agent infiltrates a white supremacist movement to prevent their planned terrorist attack. Crime thriller, starring Daniel Radcliffe and Toni Collette.

programme.title: Manhattan Night
programme.desc: Porter Wren, a columnist and crime reporter for a New York City newspaper, is convinced by the alluring Caroline Crowley to investigate her film director husband's death. Thriller, starring Adrien Brody, Yvonne Strahovski and Jennifer Beals.

programme.title: Morgan
programme.desc: A corporate risk-management consultant decides whether or not to destroy an artificially created humanoid. Sci-fi thriller, starring Kate Mara, Anya Taylor-Joy and Rose Leslie.

programme.title: The Bone Collector
programme.desc: A quadriplegic ex-cop is saved from the brink of suicide by a rookie female officer needing his expertise to form a psychological profile of a serial killer. The murderer is posing as a cab driver and terrorising Manhattan, and has a gruesome habit of taking trophies from his victims' bodies. Thriller, starring Denzel Washington, Angelina Jolie, Michael Rooker, Mike McGlone, Luis Guzman and Queen Latifah.

programme.title: Hijacked
programme.desc: FBI agent Gretchen Blair finds herself caught in the middle of an elaborate mid-air heist. Thriller, starring Denise Richards, Dolph Lundgren and Chuck Liddell.

programme.title: The Hatton Garden Job
programme.desc: A ragtag group of career criminals plot an audacious, multi-million-pound raid on an underground facility in London. True-life crime drama, with Stephen Moyer, Larry Lamb and Matthew Goode.

programme.title: Mean Machine
programme.desc: A disgraced soccer star jailed for assaulting two policemen is persuaded by the prison authorities to form a football team of inmates to take on the guards. Unfortunately, whipping his fellow prisoners into shape proves a tricky proposition. Comedy drama, starring Vinnie Jones, Jason Statham, David Hemmings and Jason Flemyng.

programme.title: Vantage Point
programme.desc: An assassination attempt is made on the life of the US president during a terrorism summit. The story unfolds from several perspectives, including that of the secret service agents charged with protecting the head of state, a news producer covering the event and a man in the crowd who may have caught the perpetrator on camera. Thriller, starring Dennis Quaid, Matthew Fox, Forest Whitaker, Sigourney Weaver and William Hurt.

programme.title: Flightplan
programme.desc: A widow boards a plane with her daughter and promptly falls asleep. When she wakes up, the girl has disappeared - and the mother's fear turns to outright panic when the aircraft crew insists she boarded the flight alone, suggesting the child is merely a figment of her distressed imagination. Thriller, starring Jodie Foster, Peter Sarsgaard, Sean Bean and Greta Scacchi.

programme.title: The French Connection
programme.desc: Two tough New York cops use unorthodox methods to try to break an international drug ring. When their information leads them to place a candy store under surveillance, they discover the owners are the American agents for a French kingpin planning to ship millions of dollars worth of heroin into the US. Oscar-winning fact-based thriller, starring Gene Hackman, Roy Scheider, Fernando Rey and Tony Lo Bianco.

programme.title: Marked for Death
programme.desc: A former narcotics agent decides it is time to retire and settle down after his partner is killed. However, his peaceful retirement comes to an abrupt end when a villainous drug dealer known as Screwface tries to kill his sister and her daughter. The enraged operative pursues the crime lord to Jamaica in search of vengeance. Action thriller, starring Steven Seagal, Basil Wallace and Joanna Pacula.

programme.title: Mine
programme.desc: Following a failed assassination attempt, a soldier is stranded in the desert where he must survive the elements and stay sane enough to survive. Thriller, starring Armie Hammer, Annabelle Wallis and Tom Cullen.

programme.title: Deep Family Secrets
programme.desc: A girl sets out on a personal quest to discover the truth about her mother's alleged abduction, and uncovers a tangled tale of adultery, incest and murder. Thriller, starring Richard Crenna, Angie Dickinson and Meg Foster.

programme.title: 10 Cent Pistol
programme.desc: A pair of low-life criminal brothers target the powerful LA mobster who left one of them rotting in prison. Crime caper, starring Jena Malone and Joe Mantegna.

programme.title: Gran Torino
programme.desc: Misanthropic Korean War veteran Walt leads an isolated existence, and has a tense relationship with his family and nothing but contempt for his neighbours. When a teenager attempts to steal his prized car, he ends up trying to reform the thief, making a connection with the boy's relatives and defending them from a street gang. Drama, directed by and starring Clint Eastwood. With Christopher Carley and Bee Vang.

programme.title: Dick Tracy
programme.desc: An incorruptible Chicago cop launches a relentless campaign to stop a ruthless gangster plotting to take control of the city. But the detective finds himself distracted by the attentions of a seductive nightclub singer and a faceless vigilante playing both sides against the middle. Comic-strip adventure, directed by and starring Warren Beatty, with Madonna, Al Pacino and Dustin Hoffman.

programme.title: The Sugarland Express
programme.desc: A distraught mother persuades her incarcerated husband to break out of prison and help her take their baby out of foster care. However, their plan misfires and they end up running from the law across Texas with a state trooper as a hostage. Steven Spielberg's drama, with Goldie Hawn, Ben Johnson and William Atherton.

programme.title: The Firm
programme.desc: Harvard law graduate Mitch is headhunted to work for a prestigious law firm, despite his wife's warnings that it is too good to be true. After two of his colleagues are murdered, Mitch is approached by the FBI and informed the company is controlled by the Mafia - leaving him in a deadly predicament. Thriller, adapted from the novel by John Grisham, starring Tom Cruise, Gene Hackman, Jeanne Tripplehorn and Holly Hunter.

programme.title: Vanilla Sky
programme.desc: The laid-back lifestyle of an arrogant New York playboy is shattered when his unstable girlfriend drives off a bridge with him in the car. Although he survives, he struggles to put his life back together in the face of a series of strange events. Cameron Crowe's remake of Spanish thriller Open Your Eyes, starring Tom Cruise, Cameron Diaz, Kurt Russell, Jason Lee and Penelope Cruz, who also appeared in the original.

programme.title: Collateral
programme.desc: A Los Angeles taxi driver picks up a sharp-suited fare and is shocked when a dead body almost plunges through his windscreen during the first stop on the journey. The enigmatic passenger then reveals he is a hitman with four more contracts to carry out before the night is over, and forces the driver to help him. Michael Mann's thriller, starring Tom Cruise and Jamie Foxx.

programme.title: A Few Good Men
programme.desc: Two marines based in Cuba stand accused of murdering a comrade-in-arms. Three Navy lawyers working on their defence unearth evidence that the soldiers may have been acting under orders, which points to a trail of corruption leading all the way to a top-ranking officer. Drama based on Aaron Sorkin's stage play, starring Tom Cruise, Demi Moore, Kevin Pollack, Jack Nicholson, Kiefer Sutherland and Kevin Bacon.

programme.title: K-Shop
programme.desc: A Bournemouth takeaway owner despairs of his drunken, abusive customers and is finally pushed to the limit when his father is killed in a violent altercation. He begins murdering the people who make his life a misery, and disposes of the bodies by making them into kebabs. Horror, starring Reece Noi and Ewen MacIntosh.

programme.title: Face/Off
programme.desc: FBI agent Sean Archer captures terrorist Castor Troy, the man who killed his son. While Troy is in a coma, Archer has the crook's face surgically grafted onto his own so he can go undercover and locate a bomb planted somewhere in Los Angeles. But then Troy regains consciousness - and in turn takes on Archer's identity. John Woo's action thriller, starring Nicolas Cage, John Travolta, Joan Allen, Gina Gershon and Dominique Swain.(n)

programme.title: Dog Eat Dog
programme.desc: A crew of former prisoners are hired by a Cleveland crime syndicate to kidnap the baby of a rival mobster. Thriller, starring Nicolas Cage, Willem Dafoe and Christopher Matthew Cook.(n)

programme.title: Angel Flight Down
programme.desc: A mercy mission runs into difficulty when the plane commissioned to airlift a sick girl suffers engine trouble and crashes on the edge of a cliff. Drama, starring Patricia Kalember and David Charvet.(n)

programme.title: Southern Fury
programme.desc: When his brother falls foul of a ruthless mobster, a straight-laced man calls on his old friend and cop to help out. Crime thriller, starring Adrian Grenier, John Cusack and Nicolas Cage.(n)

programme.title: Alleycats
programme.desc: A bicycle courier believes he has witnessed a murder, and flees for his life. However, he resolves later to uncover the truth of what he saw and investigates further, leading him into a dangerous world of political corruption and illegal bike racing. Action thriller, starring Josh Whitehouse, Eleanor Tomlinson and John Hannah.(n)

programme.title: Eliminators
programme.desc: A former federal agent in the witness protection programme is forced to come out of hiding and go on the run. Thriller, starring Scott Adkins, Stu Bennett and Daniel Caltagirone.(n)

programme.title: The Mexican
programme.desc: A petty crook finds himself in a tricky situation when he tries to smuggle an antique gun from Mexico into America for his Mob boss. As events begin to spiral out of control, his girlfriend's displeasure and a pursuing hitman only add to the would-be bootlegger's woes. Comedy thriller directed by Gore Verbinski, with Brad Pitt, Julia Roberts, James Gandolfini, Gene Hackman and JK Simmons.(n)

programme.title: The Purge: Election Year
programme.desc: The presidential election is approaching, but it remains to be seen whether anti-Purge candidate Charlie Roan can survive the night. Action horror, with Frank Grillo, Mykelti Williamson and Elizabeth Mitchell.(n)

programme.title: Panic Room
programme.desc: A single mother is determined to keep her daughter safe from harm when burglars break into their home. The pair hide out in a specially constructed sealed room, but the shelter becomes a prison when the robbers refuse to leave empty-handed. Thriller directed by David Fincher, starring Jodie Foster, Kristen Stewart, Forest Whitaker, Jared Leto and Dwight Yoakam.(n)

programme.title: Salt
programme.desc: A CIA agent is accused of being a sleeper assassin with a deadly purpose - to kill the Russian president during a diplomatic visit and start a third world war. She goes on the run, with her colleagues in hot pursuit - but each attempt to prove her innocence only raises more questions about her identity. Action thriller, starring Angelina Jolie, Liev Schreiber and Chiwetel Ejiofor.(n)

programme.title: Baby Driver
programme.desc: After being coerced into working for a crime boss, a young getaway driver with tinnitus takes part in a heist doomed to fail. Edgar Wright's music-themed action thriller, starring Ansel Elgort, Kevin Spacey and Jon Hamm.(n)

programme.title: American Gangster
programme.desc: The story of 1970s drug kingpin Frank Lucas, whose innovative methods of smuggling heroin into the US made him one of the leading figures in the New York underworld. A detective is assigned to bring Lucas's empire down, but his investigation is undermined by police corruption. Ridley Scott's fact-based crime drama, starring Denzel Washington, Russell Crowe, Chiwetel Ejiofor and Josh Brolin.(n)

programme.title: Raw
programme.desc: After a trainee vet and strict vegetarian is pressured into eating meat for the first time, she develops a craving for flesh. Horror, starring Garance Marillier, Ella Rumpf and Rabah Nait Oufella. In French.

programme.title: The Terminator
programme.desc: A cyborg assassin is sent on a murderous mission back in time to the 20th century, where he wreaks havoc while searching for his intended victim - a woman whose unborn son is destined to lead the human race in a war against machines. However, a soldier has also been sent from the future to protect her. James Cameron's sci-fi thriller, starring Arnold Schwarzenegger, Linda Hamilton and Michael Biehn.

programme.title: Pet
programme.desc: A man bumps into an old crush and becomes so obsessed with her, he holds her captive underneath the animal shelter where he works. Horror thriller, starring Dominic Monaghan, Ksenia Solo and Jennette McCurdy.

programme.title: Rampage: Special
programme.desc: Preview of Dwayne Johnson's new big-screen adventure about a troop of intelligent gorillas tearing across North America, destroying everything in their path.

programme.title: The Sixth Sense
programme.desc: A child psychologist, disheartened after the suicide of a former patient, takes on the case of a terrified boy haunted by ghostly apparitions, and tries to help him discover what the spirits want from him. M Night Shyamalan's supernatural thriller, starring Bruce Willis, Haley Joel Osment, Toni Collette and Olivia Williams.

programme.title: Independence Day
programme.desc: A fleet of huge flying saucers launches a devastating and unprovoked attack on Earth. As survivors try to flee the seemingly unstoppable alien invaders, the courageous US president, an ace pilot and a computer genius come up with a plan to take the fight to the enemy and save the human race. Roland Emmerich's sci-fi adventure, starring Will Smith, Bill Pullman, Jeff Goldblum, Mary McDonnell, Randy Quaid, Robert Loggia and Harry Connick Jr.

programme.title: Independence Day: Resurgence
programme.desc: Two decades have passed since Earth was saved from an extraterrestrial invasion, and in the years since, the aliens' salvaged technology has been used to transform the world. However, it may not be enough to save the human race when a second, even dealier attack begins. Sci-fi adventure, starring Jeff Goldblum, Liam Hemsworth and Bill Pullman.

programme.title: Transformers: The Last Knight
programme.desc: Mechanic Cade Yeager continues his fight against the evil Decepticons in a battle which takes him to England. There he joins forces with an eccentric knight and a literature professor. Fantasy adventure, starring Mark Wahlberg, Laura Haddock, Josh Duhamel and Anthony Hopkins.

programme.title: Independence Day
programme.desc: A fleet of huge flying saucers launches a devastating and unprovoked attack on Earth. As survivors try to flee the seemingly unstoppable alien invaders, the courageous US president, an ace pilot and a computer genius come up with a plan to take the fight to the enemy and save the human race. Roland Emmerich's sci-fi adventure, starring Will Smith, Bill Pullman, Jeff Goldblum, Mary McDonnell, Randy Quaid, Robert Loggia and Harry Connick Jr.

programme.title: Independence Day: Resurgence
programme.desc: Two decades have passed since Earth was saved from an extraterrestrial invasion, and in the years since, the aliens' salvaged technology has been used to transform the world. However, it may not be enough to save the human race when a second, even dealier attack begins. Sci-fi adventure, starring Jeff Goldblum, Liam Hemsworth and Bill Pullman.

programme.title: Transformers: The Last Knight
programme.desc: Mechanic Cade Yeager continues his fight against the evil Decepticons in a battle which takes him to England. There he joins forces with an eccentric knight and a literature professor. Fantasy adventure, starring Mark Wahlberg, Laura Haddock, Josh Duhamel and Anthony Hopkins.

programme.title: A Cure for Wellness
programme.desc: An executive is sent to retrieve his company's chief executive officer from a mysterious `wellness centre' in the Swiss Alps, but suspects the spa's treatments are not what they seem. Psychological thriller, starring Dane DeHaan, Mia Goth and Jason Isaacs.

programme.title: RoboCop
programme.desc: A police officer in a future Detroit ravaged by crime is seemingly killed in the line of duty, but is rebuilt as a law-enforcing cyborg by the corporation that has taken over running the force. He begins to remember his human life and seeks to bring his killers to justice - a mission that leads him to turn on his corrupt corporate masters. Sci-fi thriller, starring Peter Weller, Nancy Allen, Ronny Cox and Miguel Ferrer.

programme.title: RoboCop 2
programme.desc: The cybernetic law enforcer returns to battle a deranged drug lord. Meanwhile, he is unaware the corporation that created him has scheduled his replacement by a more powerful version. To complete the new cyborg, they need a human brain, and a renegade scientist secretly implants the injured drug lord's brain into the robot, transforming it into an uncontrollable killing machine. Sci-fi thriller sequel, starring Peter Weller, Nancy Allen, Tom Noonan and Belinda Bauer.

programme.title: Sky Cinema Preview
programme.desc: Previews of the films now playing on the Sky Cinema channels, plus other highlights showing on Sky.

programme.title: Ouija: Origin Of Evil
programme.desc: In 1967 Los Angeles, a widowed mother and her two daughters add a new stunt to boost their seance scam business. However, they get more than they bargained for when they invite an evil presence into their home. Supernatural horror prequel, starring Elizabeth Reaser and Annalise Basso.

programme.title: Spider-Man
programme.desc: A clumsy teenager develops superhuman powers after a genetically engineered spider bites him. At first his fantastic skills delight him, but his elation is severely tempered by a family tragedy, prompting him to dedicate his talents to combating evil. However, he faces a baptism of fire in the form of crazed villain the Green Goblin. Comic-book superhero adventure, with Tobey Maguire, Kirsten Dunst, Willem Dafoe, James Franco and Rosemary Harris.

programme.title: Kong: Skull Island
programme.desc: Years after two enemy pilots land on a mysterious island, a top-secret mission to the same region descends into chaos when the local wildlife proves far from welcoming. Action adventure, starring Tom Hiddleston, Samuel L Jackson and Brie Larson.

programme.title: Highlander
programme.desc: A 16th-century Scottish clansman discovers he is one of a race of immortal warriors who can only be killed by beheading, and who are destined to fight to the death until just one survives. Centuries later in modern-day New York, he prepares for a final showdown with his deadliest enemy. Fantasy action adventure, starring Christopher Lambert, Sean Connery, Clancy Brown and Roxanne Hart. Featuring a soundtrack by Queen.

programme.title: Spider-Man
programme.desc: A clumsy teenager develops superhuman powers after a genetically engineered spider bites him. At first his fantastic skills delight him, but his elation is severely tempered by a family tragedy, prompting him to dedicate his talents to combating evil. However, he faces a baptism of fire in the form of crazed villain the Green Goblin. Comic-book superhero adventure, with Tobey Maguire, Kirsten Dunst, Willem Dafoe, James Franco and Rosemary Harris.

programme.title: AI: Artificial Intelligence
programme.desc: A highly advanced robotic boy is created with one purpose - to love his owner as a parent. When he is rejected by his `mother', he is left to roam the bleak landscapes of a futuristic America with a fellow android, searching for a means of becoming a real boy in the hope of regaining her love. Steven Spielberg's sci-fi drama, starring Haley Joel Osment, Jude Law, William Hurt and Frances O'Connor.

programme.title: Kong: Skull Island
programme.desc: Years after two enemy pilots land on a mysterious island, a top-secret mission to the same region descends into chaos when the local wildlife proves far from welcoming. Action adventure, starring Tom Hiddleston, Samuel L Jackson and Brie Larson.

programme.title: Highlander
programme.desc: A 16th-century Scottish clansman discovers he is one of a race of immortal warriors who can only be killed by beheading, and who are destined to fight to the death until just one survives. Centuries later in modern-day New York, he prepares for a final showdown with his deadliest enemy. Fantasy action adventure, starring Christopher Lambert, Sean Connery, Clancy Brown and Roxanne Hart. Featuring a soundtrack by Queen.

programme.title: Ouija: Origin Of Evil
programme.desc: In 1967 Los Angeles, a widowed mother and her two daughters add a new stunt to boost their seance scam business. However, they get more than they bargained for when they invite an evil presence into their home. Supernatural horror prequel, starring Elizabeth Reaser and Annalise Basso.

programme.title: Bite
programme.desc: While on her hen night getaway, Casey, the bride-to-be, gets a seemingly harmless bite from an unknown insect, but soon develops a taste for human flesh. Horror, starring Elma Begovic, Annette Wozniak and Denise Yuen.(n)

programme.title: Downhill
programme.desc: A cyclist and his girlfriend are hunted by mysterious strangers in rural Chile after being subjected to a strange virus. Horror, starring Bryce Draper, Natalie Burn and Ariel Levy. In Spanish and English.(n)

programme.title: Arachnophobia
programme.desc: A mild-mannered doctor sets up practice in a small town, but a cloud gathers over his career due to a series of unexplained deaths. Before long, he has to convince the locals that a horde of venomous spiders is responsible and confront his intense fear of arachnids into the bargain. Comedy horror, starring Jeff Daniels, John Goodman, Julian Sands and Brian McNamara.(n)

programme.title: Close Encounters of the Third Kind: Collector's Edition
programme.desc: An electrical repairman sees a fleet of UFOs and develops an increasing fascination with mountain-shaped forms, driving his wife to despair. Meanwhile, another woman has a similar fixation after her son mysteriously vanishes, and a team of scientists investigates a series of strange events around the world. Eventually, they are all drawn to a mountain where aliens are about to make contact. Alternate cut of Steven Spielberg's sci-fi drama, with Richard Dreyfuss, Francois Truffaut and Teri Garr.(n)

programme.title: Life
programme.desc: A team of scientists on the International Space Station fight for survival when an intelligent alien life form is brought on board. The creature, nicknamed Calvin, proves it will do anthing to stay alive, and the crew risk everything to ensure it does not make its way to Earth. Sci-fi thriller, starring Jake Gyllenhaal, Rebecca Ferguson, Ryan Reynolds and Ariyon Bakare.(n)

programme.title: Star Trek Beyond
programme.desc: After the USS Enterprise is attacked during a rescue mission, Kirk, Spock and the crew struggle for survival on an alien planet while their mysterious assailant carries out his plans. Sci-fi adventure, starring Chris Pine, Zachary Quinto and Idris Elba.(n)

programme.title: King Arthur: Legend of the Sword
programme.desc: A skilled fighter clashes with the forces of evil in an attempt to become king of the Britons. Guy Ritchie's fantasy drama, starring Charlie Hunnam, Astrid Berges-Frisbey and Djimon Hounsou.(n)

programme.title: Sleepy Hollow
programme.desc: A sceptical 18th-century detective is sent to a small hamlet supposedly terrorised by a demonic headless horseman who decapitates his victims. The investigator refuses to believe in the supernatural, convinced a human killer is behind the murders - but the legend proves to be all too true. Tim Burton's gothic horror, starring Johnny Depp, Christina Ricci, Miranda Richardson and Christopher Walken.(n)

programme.title: Life
programme.desc: A team of scientists on the International Space Station fight for survival when an intelligent alien life form is brought on board. The creature, nicknamed Calvin, proves it will do anthing to stay alive, and the crew risk everything to ensure it does not make its way to Earth. Sci-fi thriller, starring Jake Gyllenhaal, Rebecca Ferguson, Ryan Reynolds and Ariyon Bakare.(n)

programme.title: Star Trek Beyond
programme.desc: After the USS Enterprise is attacked during a rescue mission, Kirk, Spock and the crew struggle for survival on an alien planet while their mysterious assailant carries out his plans. Sci-fi adventure, starring Chris Pine, Zachary Quinto and Idris Elba.(n)

programme.title: King Arthur: Legend of the Sword
programme.desc: A skilled fighter clashes with the forces of evil in an attempt to become king of the Britons. Guy Ritchie's fantasy drama, starring Charlie Hunnam, Astrid Berges-Frisbey and Djimon Hounsou.(n)

programme.title: Sleepy Hollow
programme.desc: A sceptical 18th-century detective is sent to a small hamlet supposedly terrorised by a demonic headless horseman who decapitates his victims. The investigator refuses to believe in the supernatural, convinced a human killer is behind the murders - but the legend proves to be all too true. Tim Burton's gothic horror, starring Johnny Depp, Christina Ricci, Miranda Richardson and Christopher Walken.(n)

programme.title: Wakefield
programme.desc: A successful suburban family man apparently vanishes one day, and proceeds to secretly observe his wife and children from their garage attic. Drama, starring Bryan Cranston, Jennifer Garner and Beverly D'Angelo.

programme.title: Within
programme.desc: A family moves to a peaceful suburban neighbourhood to start a new life, but the dark history of their seemingly perfect home soon emerges. Horror, starring Michael Vartan, Erin Moriarty and Nadine Velazquez.

programme.title: The Top Ten Show
programme.desc: Which movies are doing the best business at home and across the pond? Clips from the UK and US Top Ten show you the best of what's on offer on the big screen.

programme.title: Titan AE
programme.desc: In the year 3038, an alien race has annihilated almost all of mankind and destroyed the Earth. A scientist escapes the planet on board a craft that is destined to be humanity's only chance of future survival - the spaceship Titan. Fourteen years later, his estranged son plucks up courage and sets out on a perilous journey to find the ship and reunite with his father. Animated sci-fi adventure, with the voices of Matt Damon, Bill Pullman and Drew Barrymore.

programme.title: Billy Lynn's Long Halftime Walk
programme.desc: A 19-year-old private is brought home for a victory tour after a harrowing Iraq battle, as flashbacks show what really happened to his squad - contrasting the realities of war with America's perceptions. Drama, starring Joe Alwyn, Garrett Hedlund and Arturo Castro.

programme.title: Storks
programme.desc: Animated adventure about a world where storks now deliver everything but babies, until an office mishap that is. With the voices of Andy Samberg, Kelsey Grammer and Katie Crown.

programme.title: Beauty and the Beast
programme.desc: A cursed prince falls for a young woman after she takes the place of her abducted father in his enchanted castle, and only her love can prevent him from remaining a creature forever. Musical fairy tale, starring Emma Watson, Dan Stevens and Luke Evans.

programme.title: Rogue One: A Star Wars Story
programme.desc: In a galaxy far, far away, maverick scientist's daughter Jyn Erso and the Rebel Alliance attempt to steal plans for a battle station capable of destroying entire worlds - the Death Star. Star Wars prequel set before the events of A New Hope, starring Felicity Jones, Diego Luna and Ben Mendelsohn.

programme.title: Body of Lies
programme.desc: CIA agent Roger Ferris hatches a bold but dangerous plan to capture terrorist Al-Saleem. With the help of Ed Hoffman who is a master of subterfuge, Ferris creates a fake terrorist organization to prompt Al-Saleem out of hiding. Spy thriller, starring Leonardo DiCaprio and Russell Crowe.

programme.title: Storks
programme.desc: Animated adventure about a world where storks now deliver everything but babies, until an office mishap that is. With the voices of Andy Samberg, Kelsey Grammer and Katie Crown.

programme.title: Beauty and the Beast
programme.desc: A cursed prince falls for a young woman after she takes the place of her abducted father in his enchanted castle, and only her love can prevent him from remaining a creature forever. Musical fairy tale, starring Emma Watson, Dan Stevens and Luke Evans.

programme.title: Rogue One: A Star Wars Story
programme.desc: In a galaxy far, far away, maverick scientist's daughter Jyn Erso and the Rebel Alliance attempt to steal plans for a battle station capable of destroying entire worlds - the Death Star. Star Wars prequel set before the events of A New Hope, starring Felicity Jones, Diego Luna and Ben Mendelsohn.

programme.title: Table 19
programme.desc: Dumped by the best man via text, a former maid of honour decides to pitch up at her friend's wedding anyway. Comedy, starring Anna Kendrick, Craig Robinson and Lisa Kudrow.

programme.title: The Escorts
programme.desc: A cash-strapped dad-to-be goes way out of his depth when he unwittingly takes a gig chauffeuring a trio of call girls. Comedy, starring Jason Biggs, Janet Montgomery and Ashley Tisdale.

programme.title: Desierto
programme.desc: A group of immigrants hoping to make it across the US-Mexico border are targeted by a deranged, gun-wielding vigilante. Thriller, starring Gael Garcia Bernal and Jeffrey Dean Morgan.

programme.title: Finding Altamira
programme.desc: Controversy erupts after the discovery of allegedly ancient cave paintings in northern Spain in 1879. Period drama from Chariots of Fire director Hugh Hudson, starring Antonio Banderas and Golshifteh Farahani.

programme.title: Goldstone
programme.desc: A hard-drinking Australian detective uncovers a web of corruption while on the trail of a missing tourist. Thriller, starring Aaron Pedersen, Alex Russell and Jacki Weaver.

programme.title: Hungry Hearts
programme.desc: A young mother becomes irrationally and dangerously fixated with her baby's health. Psychological drama, starring Adam Driver, Alba Rohrwacher and Roberta Maxwell.

programme.title: Monster Family
programme.desc: A young family cursed by a witch and transformed into monsters. Animated comedy, with the voices of Emily Watson, Jason Isaacs and Nick Frost.

programme.title: Safe House
programme.desc: A CIA agent stationed in South Africa is sent to question a rogue operative, who has been arrested years after betraying the agency, only to be attacked by mercenaries hired to capture the fugitive. As they flee for their lives, the interrogator has to contend with not only the enemies hunting them, but also the mind games of his prisoner. Thriller, with Denzel Washington and Ryan Reynolds.

programme.title: John Wick: Chapter 2
programme.desc: When a scheming Italian crime lord holds him to a blood oath, reluctant hitman John Wick goes on another murderous rampage. Action sequel, starring Keanu Reeves, Riccardo Scamarcio and Ian McShane.

programme.title: Groundhog Day
programme.desc: An obnoxious TV weatherman reporting on a small town's annual festival finds himself caught in a bizarre time loop, and is forced to relive the same day over and over again. While at first he tries to exploit his predicament, he is ultimately driven to mend his ways and adopt a less cynical attitude. Comedy, starring Bill Murray, Andie MacDowell, Chris Elliott and Stephen Tobolowsky.

programme.title: Monster Family
programme.desc: A young family cursed by a witch and transformed into monsters. Animated comedy, with the voices of Emily Watson, Jason Isaacs and Nick Frost.

programme.title: Safe House
programme.desc: A CIA agent stationed in South Africa is sent to question a rogue operative, who has been arrested years after betraying the agency, only to be attacked by mercenaries hired to capture the fugitive. As they flee for their lives, the interrogator has to contend with not only the enemies hunting them, but also the mind games of his prisoner. Thriller, with Denzel Washington and Ryan Reynolds.

programme.title: John Wick: Chapter 2
programme.desc: When a scheming Italian crime lord holds him to a blood oath, reluctant hitman John Wick goes on another murderous rampage. Action sequel, starring Keanu Reeves, Riccardo Scamarcio and Ian McShane.

programme.title: The Shallows
programme.desc: Medical student Nancy Adams' plan to honour her late mother puts her face to face with a massive, man-eating shark. Survival horror, starring Blake Lively and Oscar Jaenada.

programme.title: The Girl with All the Gifts
programme.desc: A scientist and a teacher living in a dystopian future embark on a journey of survival with a young girl named Melanie. Horror thriller, starring Gemma Arterton, Paddy Considine, Glenn Close and Sennia Nanua.(n)

programme.title: Larry Gaye: Renegade Male Flight Attendant
programme.desc: A womanising flight attendant springs into action when his cost-cutting airline plans to eliminate jobs. Comedy, starring Mark Feuerstein, Danny Pudi and Jayma Mays.(n)

programme.title: Groundhog Day
programme.desc: An obnoxious TV weatherman reporting on a small town's annual festival finds himself caught in a bizarre time loop, and is forced to relive the same day over and over again. While at first he tries to exploit his predicament, he is ultimately driven to mend his ways and adopt a less cynical attitude. Comedy, starring Bill Murray, Andie MacDowell, Chris Elliott and Stephen Tobolowsky.(n)

programme.title: In a Valley of Violence
programme.desc: While en route to Mexico, a mysterious drifter and his dog run afoul of the thugs running a dead-end mining town. Western, starring Ethan Hawke, John Travolta and Karen Gillan.(n)

programme.title: Smurfs: The Lost Village
programme.desc: A mysterious map sends Smurfette, Brainy, Clumsy and Hefty on a quest into the Forbidden Forest. Animated adventure, with the voices of Demi Lovato and Julia Roberts.(n)

programme.title: Central Intelligence (Extended Version) (2016)
programme.desc: Years after being humiliated as a student, rogue CIA agent Robbie Wheirdicht turns to old classmate Calvin Joyner for help when he's targeted by his own organisation. Extended version of the action comedy, starring Dwayne Johnson, Kevin Hart and Amy Ryan.(n)

programme.title: Baywatch Extended Cut
programme.desc: A lifeguard teams up with a new recruit to scupper a criminal scheme. Action comedy based on the TV series, starring Dwayne Johnson and Zac Efron.(n)

programme.title: Fast & Furious 8
programme.desc: When a mysterious woman seduces Dominic Toretto into the world of terrorism, the crew faces the biggest trials of their lives. Action sequel, starring Vin Diesel, Charlize Theron and Dwayne Johnson.(n)

programme.title: Smurfs: The Lost Village
programme.desc: A mysterious map sends Smurfette, Brainy, Clumsy and Hefty on a quest into the Forbidden Forest. Animated adventure, with the voices of Demi Lovato and Julia Roberts.(n)

programme.title: Central Intelligence (Extended Version) (2016)
programme.desc: Years after being humiliated as a student, rogue CIA agent Robbie Wheirdicht turns to old classmate Calvin Joyner for help when he's targeted by his own organisation. Extended version of the action comedy, starring Dwayne Johnson, Kevin Hart and Amy Ryan.(n)

programme.title: Baywatch Extended Cut
programme.desc: A lifeguard teams up with a new recruit to scupper a criminal scheme. Action comedy based on the TV series, starring Dwayne Johnson and Zac Efron.(n)

programme.title: Fast & Furious 8
programme.desc: When a mysterious woman seduces Dominic Toretto into the world of terrorism, the crew faces the biggest trials of their lives. Action sequel, starring Vin Diesel, Charlize Theron and Dwayne Johnson.(n)

programme.title: 52 Tuesdays
programme.desc: Drama, following sixteen-year-old Billie's reluctant path to independence, which is accelerated when her lesbian mother Jane reveals plans to gender transition and become James. Billie goes to live with her father Tom for a year, so the time she can spend with James is limited to Tuesdays between 4pm and 10pm, but before returning home every Tuesday evening to her father she has secret encounters with two older students in a flat. Starring Tilda Cobham-Hervey and Del Herbert-Jane.

programme.title: Send Me No Flowers
programme.desc: A hypochondriac who mistakenly believes he has only a few weeks to live decides not to tell his wife - and also sets about finding her a suitable second husband to succeed him. Romantic comedy, teaming Rock Hudson and Doris Day with Tony Randall, Paul Lynde and Edward Andrews.

programme.title: Man Without a Star
programme.desc: A wandering cowboy and his naive travelling partner are hired by an ambitious ranch owner, who wishes to expand her territory at the cost of her struggling neighbours. The drifter sympathises with the plight of the other farmers, but disapproves of the methods they intend to use to mark their territory. King Vidor's Western, starring Kirk Douglas, Jeanne Crain, William Campbell, Richard Boone and Claire Trevor.

programme.title: Broken Arrow
programme.desc: A former Union scout is befriended by famed chief Cochise after he saves the life of a native boy. Having witnessed 10 years of conflict between Apaches and advancing settlers, the veteran soldier seizes the fleeting chance to broker a ceasefire between the two sides. Western, starring James Stewart, Jeff Chandler, Debra Paget and Basil Ruysdael.

programme.title: Track of the Cat
programme.desc: A troubled family starts to fall apart during a harsh winter in 19th-century northern California while staving off the menacing presence of a predator - until a tragic accident finally brings matters to a head. Western melodrama, starring Robert Mitchum, Teresa Wright and Diana Lynn.

programme.title: Down with Love
programme.desc: A writer in early 1960s New York creates a national sensation with her bestselling book in which she claims women do not need men to make them happy. A womanising reporter sets out to prove her wrong by making her fall in love with him - only to end up head over heels himself. Romantic comedy, starring Ewan McGregor, Renee Zellweger, David Hyde Pierce and Sarah Paulson.

programme.title: Beast Interview Special
programme.desc: Director Michael Pearce and actress Jessie Buckley talk about making the dark British drama set on Jersey.

programme.title: Dark Places
programme.desc: Premiere. A seven-year-old girl witnesses the murder of her mother and sisters, and testifies that her teenage brother was the killer, leading to his imprisonment. As an adult, she attends a gathering of true-crime fans, and discovers they all think her brother was innocent. She reluctantly agrees to revisit the crime, and begins to realise her memories may not be as reliable as she thought. Mystery, starring Charlize Theron, Nicholas Hoult, Christina Hendricks and Chloe Grace Moretz.

programme.title: Wild Tales
programme.desc: Anthology of six stories in which ordinary people react to everyday social grievances in unexpected ways, leading to bizarre consequences. The tales include a chance encounter on a plane, a tragic revelation at a wedding and an incident of road rage that turns into class warfare. Comedy drama anthology, starring Dario Grandinetti and Maria Marull. In Spanish.

programme.title: Taxi Driver
programme.desc: An isolated, misanthropic New York cab driver becomes increasingly disturbed by the corruption he sees all around him. His desperate attempts to make connections with a political campaigner and a teenage prostitute, whom he feels compelled to save, seem doomed to failure, and he is gradually driven towards a brutal act of violence. Martin Scorsese's drama, starring Robert De Niro, Jodie Foster, Cybill Shepherd and Harvey Keitel.

programme.title: Guns at Batasi
programme.desc: Rebels besiege the headquarters of a British battalion garrisoned in Africa, enraged by the officers' refusal to give up a prisoner. Meanwhile, the sergeant major struggles to maintain order in his increasingly tense surroundings. Drama, starring Richard Attenborough, Jack Hawkins, Flora Robson and Mia Farrow.

programme.title: Winchester '73
programme.desc: A gunslinger tracks down his father's killer, but is unable to exact his revenge because the sheriff of the town makes a point of confiscating all firearms. Instead he challenges him to compete in a shooting competition to win a superb rifle, but when the murderer loses, he steals the coveted prize. Western, starring James Stewart, Shelley Winters, Dan Duryea and Stephen McNally.

programme.title: The Black Knight
programme.desc: A humble sword-maker in the kingdom of King Arthur sets out to prove his worth as a knight in a bid to impress a nobleman's daughter. While fighting to foil an invasion, he discovers the attacking army is in league with traitors in the royal court. Swashbuckling adventure, starring Alan Ladd, Peter Cushing, Patricia Medina, Patrick Troughton and John Laurie.

programme.title: We're No Angels
programme.desc: Three convicts escape from the penal colony on notorious Devil's Island and seize a French family's shop - only to find themselves helping the storekeeper outwit his scheming relatives. Comedy, starring Humphrey Bogart, Peter Ustinov, Aldo Ray and Basil Rathbone.

programme.title: Congo
programme.desc: An expedition to find King Solomon's diamond mines in the jungles of the Congo disappears without trace. The tycoon behind the mission sends his assistant, a former CIA agent, to find out what became of the explorers - only to discover that the party met a grisly fate at the hands of a horde of vicious apes. Action adventure based on Michael Crichton's novel, with Dylan Walsh, Laura Linney, Tim Curry and Grant Heslov.

programme.title: Crimson Peak
programme.desc: An aspiring writer marries a British aristocrat, and goes to live with him and his sister in their sinister ancestral home. She is tormented by ghostly apparitions and seeks to uncover the terrifying secrets in the family's past. Guillermo del Toro's gothic horror, starring Mia Wasikowska, Tom Hiddleston and Jessica Chastain.

programme.title: Stoker
programme.desc: A teenager living an isolated life in her mother's remote estate discovers she has an uncle she has never met following her father's death. The mysterious relative moves into the house and seems to take over his brother's role in the family. His niece suspects he has sinister motives, but becomes dangerously infatuated with him. Thriller, starring Mia Wasikowska, Nicole Kidman and Matthew Goode.

programme.title: Excision
programme.desc: A disturbed teenage girl is a social outcast at her school and harbours twisted fantasies about performing surgery on her classmates. She becomes desperate to win her mother's approval and goes to insane lengths to prove her worth, while also striving to cure her sister's cystic fibrosis. Comedy horror, starring AnnaLynne McCord, Traci Lords and Malcolm McDowell.(n)

programme.title: Terror in a Texas Town
programme.desc: An embittered Scandinavian seaman sets out to avenge the murder of his farmer father, who was killed after refusing to bow to the demands of a ruthless land baron. Western, starring Sterling Hayden, Sebastian Cabot, Carol Kelly and Eugene Martin.(n)

programme.title: The Spoilers
programme.desc: Two successful gold prospectors team up with a saloon owner in 19th-century Alaska to protect their mining rights from an unscrupulous rival and a corrupt judge determined to get rich at their expense. Western, starring Anne Baxter, Jeff Chandler and Rory Calhoun.(n)

programme.title: Gun Fury
programme.desc: A wealthy rancher and his fiancee take the stagecoach to California, where they intend to start a new life in the wake of the Civil War. However, during the journey an ex-Confederate outlaw and his gang of thugs attack the coach and kidnap the bride-to-be. Distraught and wounded, the rancher sets out to rescue her and punish her abductors. Western, with Rock Hudson, Donna Reed, Lee Marvin and Phil Carey.(n)

programme.title: Three Faces West
programme.desc: An Austrian doctor and his daughter arrive in the dust bowl regions of America after fleeing the Nazis, and join the exodus of farmers seeking fertile land in Oregon. The daughter falls for the pioneer leading the journey, despite being engaged to the man who helped her escape the Third Reich. Drama, starring John Wayne, Charles Coburn and Sigrid Gurie.(n)

programme.title: Hondo
programme.desc: A hard-boiled cavalry scout with a feral dog as companion stumbles across a woman and her child stranded on their homestead deep inside hostile territory. Despite repeated attacks by the Apaches, they refuse to leave their home, leaving the scout with no choice but to stay and defend her. Western, starring John Wayne, Geraldine Page, Ward Bond and Michael Pate.(n)

programme.title: Fantastic Four: Rise of the Silver Surfer
programme.desc: The super-powered team takes on a mysterious alien who has been sent by his planet-eating master to prepare Earth for obliteration. While the four heroes try to find a way to foil its plans, an old enemy returns, intent on seizing the extraterrestrial's power. Sci-fi adventure sequel, starring Ioan Gruffudd, Michael Chiklis, Chris Evans and Jessica Alba, with the voice of Laurence Fishburne.(n)

programme.title: The Dressmaker
programme.desc: An Australian fashion designer returns to her remote home town in the 1950s after forging a successful career in Paris. She reconciles with her mother, falls in love and transforms the lives of the local women - getting even with her enemies in the process. Drama based on the novel by Rosalie Ham, starring Kate Winslet, Judy Davis, Hugo Weaving and Liam Hemsworth.(n)

programme.title: Regression
programme.desc: Premiere. In 1990, Minnesota detective Bruce Kenner finds evidence of a satanic cult when he investigates the case of John Gray, who admits to sexually abusing his 17-year-old daughter Angela, but has no recollection of it. Psychological thriller, starring Ethan Hawke, Emma Watson and David Thewlis.(n)

programme.title: The Waltons
programme.desc: Grandma is admitted to hospital, but Grandpa does not cope well with being away from her. Corabeth thinks Elizabeth is a bad influence on Aimee, and forbids them from being friends.

programme.title: The Waltons
programme.desc: The Baldwin sisters' niece returns to America after living in Germany, and John Boy suspects she is running away from something terrible that happened there.

programme.title: Little House on the Prairie

programme.desc: An advertising executive's wife walks out, leaving him to raise their children alone - a problem compounded by his mother's death in a car accident. Drama, starring Patrick Duffy, Lynda Carter, Kate Mulgrew and featuring an early appearance by Ben Affleck.

programme.title: Danielle Steel's Message from Nam
programme.desc: Part two of two. Paxton's work as a war correspondent in Vietnam, combined with the mixed rewards of her affair with an Army captain, begins to take its toll. Drama, starring Jenny Robertson, Rue McClanahan and Esther Rolle.

programme.title: The Waltons

programme.title: Providence
programme.desc: As the wedding draws nearer Syd suffers from nightmares about her big day. Drama, starring Melina Kanakarades and Mike Farrell.

programme.title: Daniel's Daughter
programme.desc: A magazine editor receives news of her estranged father's death, and agrees to fulfil his final wish to scatter his ashes at the family's old home, an undertaking forces her to confront the past she left behind. Drama, starring Laura Leighton, London Angelis, Martin Doyle, Brandon Firla and Dorly Jean-Louis.

programme.title: Straight from the Heart
programme.desc: A jilted New York woman despairs of ever finding the man of her dreams, until a personal ad leads to contact with a lonesome cowboy. Leaving the city behind her, she heads west to start a new life at his side - but their relationship struggles because of their differences. Romantic drama, starring Teri Polo, Andrew McCarthy, Greg Evigan and Christine Tucci.

programme.title: Little Women
programme.desc: Part two of two. Drama based on Louisa May Alcott's novel about four sisters growing up together in New England during the American Civil War. Starring Meredith Baxter, Susan Dey and Eve Plumb.

programme.title: Sundays at Tiffany's
programme.desc: Ambitious theatre manager Jane Claremont, soon to be married to her TV actor fiance, is surprised when Michael - her imaginary friend from when she was 10 years old - suddenly returns. What's more, this time everyone else can see him. No longer a figment of anyone's imagination, Michael tries to find out why he has been conjured into existence, while helping Jane realise what she truly wants from her life. Romance, starring Alyssa Milano, Eric Winter and Stockard Channing.

programme.title: Sundays at Tiffany's

No longer a figment of anyone's imagination, Michael tries to find out why he has been conjured into existence, while helping Jane realise what she truly wants from her life. Romance, starring Alyssa Milano, Eric Winter and Stockard Channing.

programme.title: We'll Meet Again
programme.desc: A woman convicted of her husband's murder is released from prison and resolves to clear her name. She enlists the help of a TV reporter friend, and as the pair delve into the events surrounding the killing, they uncover a sinister secret and a conspiracy to keep it hidden at any cost. Crime thriller based on the book by Mary Higgins Clark, starring Laura Leighton, Brandy Ledford and Gedeon Burkhard.

programme.title: The Waltons
programme.desc: John-Boy needs some peace and quiet to finish writing his book. Ben quits his job at the newspaper and becomes a car salesman, but picks up some dishonest habits.

programme.title: The Waltons
programme.desc: John-Boy has heard nothing from the publisher whom he sent his book, so goes to New York to find out if it is going to be printed.

programme.title: Little House on the Prairie
programme.desc: Sarah Carter's father causes problems when he arrives in Walnut Grove and tries to persuade his family to give up the simple life and enjoy a luxurious existence in New York.

programme.title: Little House on the Prairie
programme.desc: Isaiah Edwards is mistakenly identified as part of an outlaw gang when the infamous Younger brothers are released from prison and set about rebuilding their reputation.

programme.title: Providence
programme.desc: A schizophrenic patient becomes obsessed with Syd, prompting her to seek refuge at Owen's house. Drama, starring Melina Kanakarades and Mike Farrell.

programme.title: Providence
programme.desc: With her stalker closing in on her, Syd finds herself trapped in the hospital as a fire breaks out. Drama, starring Melina Kanakaredes and Mike Farrell.

programme.title: Highway to Heaven
programme.desc: Jonathan spends Christmas trying to persuade a cynical writer that there is still good in the world.

programme.title: Highway to Heaven
programme.desc: Jonathan and Mark pose as priests so they can re-open an abandoned church as shelter for people who have lost their homes in a fire. Guest starring Didi Conn (Grease).

programme.title: Danielle Steel's A Perfect Stranger
programme.desc: A woman resigned to nursing her bedridden husband is swept off her feet by a handsome stranger and soon realises she is falling in love - but guilt and responsibility get the better of her. Romantic drama, starring Stacy Haiduk, Robert Urich and Darren McGavin.

programme.title: Loving Evangeline
programme.desc: A software executive returns to his boyhood home in Nova Scotia to investigate the mysterious death of his brother in a boating incident, and joins forces with a local widow who believes the tragedy was not accidental. Romantic thriller, starring Nick Mancuso, Kelly Rowan, Karl Bury and Winston Reckert.

programme.title: The Waltons
programme.desc: A cousin of the family arrives with her baby, having left her husband whom she believes is being unfaithful.

programme.title: Providence
programme.sub-title: Things That Go Bump in the Night
programme.desc: Syd loses her engagement ring while working a double shift on Hallowe'en. Drama, starring Melina Kanakaredes and Mike Farrell.

programme.title: Charms for the Easy Life
programme.desc: A self-educated freethinking woman takes in her adult daughter and grandchild, and encourages them both to follow their dreams. While the grandmother is busy with an ongoing feud with a local doctor, the two younger women overcome their distrust of men and begin to fall in love - one with a lawyer, the other with a wounded soldier. Period drama set in the 1930s, with Gena Rowlands, Mimi Rogers, Susan May Pratt and Kenneth Mitchell.

programme.title: Touching Wild Horses
programme.desc: A youngster is forced to go to live with his aunt on an isolated Canadian island following the death of his parents, and forms a bond with an orphaned wild pony - a relationship that helps him deal with his grief. Drama, starring Jane Seymour, Mark Rendall and James McGowan.

programme.title: The Winds of War
programme.desc: Part one of two. Drama documenting the early years of the Second World War. A US Naval officer makes a journey to Nazi Germany to take up a job at the embassy. With Robert Mitchum.

programme.title: Anonymous
programme.desc: The earl of Oxford, a courtier to Elizabeth I, is unable to put his name to the poetry and plays he has written, so allows a commoner named William Shakespeare to take the credit. He endeavours to keep his secret hidden as he is drawn into political intrigue in the royal court. Counterfactual period thriller, starring Rhys Ifans, Vanessa Redgrave and Rafe Spall.

programme.title: The Waltons
programme.desc: The family find a runaway boy hiding in the barn, and learns he has walked all the way from North Carolina. Guest starring Todd Bridges.(n)

programme.title: Little House on the Prairie
programme.desc: Laura wins a writing competition and travels to Minneapolis to meet a publisher who encourages her to pen her first book. However, the editor has other ideas for her work.(n)

programme.title: Providence

programme.title: Providence

programme.title: Highway to Heaven
programme.desc: Jonathan and Mark's latest assignment is Wally, a lovable elderly hobo and street puppeteer whose caring and good nature have made him, without him knowing, into an angel. Dick Van Dyke guest stars.(n)

programme.desc: Jonathan and Mark pose as priests so they can re-open an abandoned church as shelter for people who have lost their homes in a fire. Guest starring Didi Conn (Grease).(n)

programme.title: Danielle Steel's Star
programme.desc: A woman dreams of escaping the drudgery of everyday life and becoming a successful singer. A romance with a handsome stranger offers her hope - but the lovebirds are soon separated, and her spirits take another battering. Romantic drama, starring Jennie Garth, Craig Bierko, Terry Farrell and Ted Wass.(n)

programme.title: Magic Moments
programme.desc: A successful magician is approached to do a TV special and falls in love with the show's producer, but her possessive adoptive father sets out to sabotage the romance. Drama, starring John Shea and Jenny Seagrove, with Paul Freeman.(n)

programme.desc: Mary Ellen needs help studying for her medical training, so offers to help a nurse as she treats a dying woman.(n)

programme.desc: A black engineer takes a teaching job at a tough London school to make ends meet, and over the course of his difficult first term, struggles to gain the respect of his disruptive pupils. Drama, starring Sidney Poitier, Christian Roberts, Judy Geeson, Geoffrey Bayldon, Patricia Routledge, Christopher Chittell and Lulu.(n)

programme.title: To Sir, with Love 2
programme.desc: After 30 years teaching in London, Mark Thackeray retires and returns to his home town of Chicago. However, the sight of a deprived school inspires him to return to duty and make a difference in the lives of more struggling students. Drama sequel, starring Sidney Poitier and Daniel J Travanti.(n)

programme.title: The Winds of War
programme.desc: Part one of two. Drama documenting the early years of the Second World War. A US Naval officer makes a journey to Nazi Germany to take up a job at the embassy. With Robert Mitchum.(n)

programme.title: The Way We Were
programme.desc: Upper-class novelist Hubbell Gardiner and Jewish political activist Katie Morosky meet at college in the 1930s and later marry. Although very much in love, their opposing political outlooks lead to conflict when Hubbell's successful career as a Hollywood screenwriter is compromised by his wife's socialist leanings. As the 1950s dawn it becomes clear their differences are too great to overcome. Romantic drama, with Robert Redford, Barbra Streisand, Bradford Dillman and Murray Hamilton.(n)

programme.title: Straight from the Heart
programme.desc: A jilted New York woman despairs of ever finding the man of her dreams, until a personal ad leads to contact with a lonesome cowboy. Leaving the city behind her, she heads west to start a new life at his side - but their relationship struggles because of their differences. Romantic drama, starring Teri Polo, Andrew McCarthy, Greg Evigan and Christine Tucci.

programme.title: Little Women
programme.desc: Part two of two. Drama based on Louisa May Alcott's novel about four sisters growing up together in New England during the American Civil War. Starring Meredith Baxter, Susan Dey and Eve Plumb.

programme.title: Sundays at Tiffany's
programme.desc: Ambitious theatre manager Jane Claremont, soon to be married to her TV actor fiance, is surprised when Michael - her imaginary friend from when she was 10 years old - suddenly returns. What's more, this time everyone else can see him. No longer a figment of anyone's imagination, Michael tries to find out why he has been conjured into existence, while helping Jane realise what she truly wants from her life. Romance, starring Alyssa Milano, Eric Winter and Stockard Channing.

programme.title: Sundays at Tiffany's
programme.desc: Ambitious theatre manager Jane Claremont, soon to be married to her TV actor fiance, is surprised when Michael - her imaginary friend from when she was 10 years old - suddenly returns. What's more, this time everyone else can see him. No longer a figment of anyone's imagination, Michael tries to find out why he has been conjured into existence, while helping Jane realise what she truly wants from her life. Romance, starring Alyssa Milano, Eric Winter and Stockard Channing.

programme.title: We'll Meet Again
programme.desc: A woman convicted of her husband's murder is released from prison and resolves to clear her name. She enlists the help of a TV reporter friend, and as the pair delve into the events surrounding the killing, they uncover a sinister secret and a conspiracy to keep it hidden at any cost. Crime thriller based on the book by Mary Higgins Clark, starring Laura Leighton, Brandy Ledford and Gedeon Burkhard.

programme.title: The Waltons
programme.desc: John-Boy needs some peace and quiet to finish writing his book. Ben quits his job at the newspaper and becomes a car salesman, but picks up some dishonest habits.

programme.title: The Waltons
programme.desc: John-Boy has heard nothing from the publisher whom he sent his book, so goes to New York to find out if it is going to be printed.

programme.title: Little House on the Prairie
programme.desc: Sarah Carter's father causes problems when he arrives in Walnut Grove and tries to persuade his family to give up the simple life and enjoy a luxurious existence in New York.

programme.title: Little House on the Prairie
programme.desc: Isaiah Edwards is mistakenly identified as part of an outlaw gang when the infamous Younger brothers are released from prison and set about rebuilding their reputation.

programme.title: Providence
programme.desc: A schizophrenic patient becomes obsessed with Syd, prompting her to seek refuge at Owen's house. Drama, starring Melina Kanakarades and Mike Farrell.

programme.title: Providence
programme.desc: With her stalker closing in on her, Syd finds herself trapped in the hospital as a fire breaks out. Drama, starring Melina Kanakaredes and Mike Farrell.

programme.title: Highway to Heaven
programme.desc: Jonathan spends Christmas trying to persuade a cynical writer that there is still good in the world.

programme.title: Highway to Heaven
programme.desc: Jonathan and Mark pose as priests so they can re-open an abandoned church as shelter for people who have lost their homes in a fire. Guest starring Didi Conn (Grease).

programme.title: Danielle Steel's A Perfect Stranger
programme.desc: A woman resigned to nursing her bedridden husband is swept off her feet by a handsome stranger and soon realises she is falling in love - but guilt and responsibility get the better of her. Romantic drama, starring Stacy Haiduk, Robert Urich and Darren McGavin.

programme.title: Loving Evangeline
programme.desc: A software executive returns to his boyhood home in Nova Scotia to investigate the mysterious death of his brother in a boating incident, and joins forces with a local widow who believes the tragedy was not accidental. Romantic thriller, starring Nick Mancuso, Kelly Rowan, Karl Bury and Winston Reckert.

programme.title: The Waltons
programme.desc: A cousin of the family arrives with her baby, having left her husband whom she believes is being unfaithful.

programme.title: Providence
programme.sub-title: Things That Go Bump in the Night
programme.desc: Syd loses her engagement ring while working a double shift on Hallowe'en. Drama, starring Melina Kanakaredes and Mike Farrell.

programme.title: Charms for the Easy Life
programme.desc: A self-educated freethinking woman takes in her adult daughter and grandchild, and encourages them both to follow their dreams. While the grandmother is busy with an ongoing feud with a local doctor, the two younger women overcome their distrust of men and begin to fall in love - one with a lawyer, the other with a wounded soldier. Period drama set in the 1930s, with Gena Rowlands, Mimi Rogers, Susan May Pratt and Kenneth Mitchell.

programme.title: Touching Wild Horses
programme.desc: A youngster is forced to go to live with his aunt on an isolated Canadian island following the death of his parents, and forms a bond with an orphaned wild pony - a relationship that helps him deal with his grief. Drama, starring Jane Seymour, Mark Rendall and James McGowan.

programme.title: The Winds of War
programme.desc: Part one of two. Drama documenting the early years of the Second World War. A US Naval officer makes a journey to Nazi Germany to take up a job at the embassy. With Robert Mitchum.

programme.title: Anonymous
programme.desc: The earl of Oxford, a courtier to Elizabeth I, is unable to put his name to the poetry and plays he has written, so allows a commoner named William Shakespeare to take the credit. He endeavours to keep his secret hidden as he is drawn into political intrigue in the royal court. Counterfactual period thriller, starring Rhys Ifans, Vanessa Redgrave and Rafe Spall.

programme.title: The Waltons
programme.desc: A hawk is attacking the Waltons' chickens, so Grandpa and Jim-Bob set out to catch it. Meanwhile, a new minister joins the community.(n)

programme.title: The Waltons
programme.desc: The family find a runaway boy hiding in the barn, and learns he has walked all the way from North Carolina. Guest starring Todd Bridges.(n)

programme.title: Little House on the Prairie
programme.desc: Laura wins a writing competition and travels to Minneapolis to meet a publisher who encourages her to pen her first book. However, the editor has other ideas for her work.(n)

programme.title: Little House on the Prairie
programme.desc: Part one of two. Charles returns to Walnut Grove with son Albert in an attempt to steer him away from the influence of bad company.(n)

programme.title: Providence
programme.desc: Syd faces the challenge of raising money to re-build the hospital, as well as working with a new boss. Drama, starring Melina Kanakaredes and Mike Farrell.(n)

programme.title: Providence
programme.desc: Syd begins to have second thoughts about marrying Owen. Drama, starring Melina Kanakarades and Mike Farrell.(n)

programme.title: Highway to Heaven
programme.desc: Jonathan and Mark's latest assignment is Wally, a lovable elderly hobo and street puppeteer whose caring and good nature have made him, without him knowing, into an angel. Dick Van Dyke guest stars.(n)

programme.title: Danielle Steel's Star
programme.desc: A woman dreams of escaping the drudgery of everyday life and becoming a successful singer. A romance with a handsome stranger offers her hope - but the lovebirds are soon separated, and her spirits take another battering. Romantic drama, starring Jennie Garth, Craig Bierko, Terry Farrell and Ted Wass.(n)

programme.title: Magic Moments
programme.desc: A successful magician is approached to do a TV special and falls in love with the show's producer, but her possessive adoptive father sets out to sabotage the romance. Drama, starring John Shea and Jenny Seagrove, with Paul Freeman.(n)

programme.title: The Waltons
programme.desc: Mary Ellen needs help studying for her medical training, so offers to help a nurse as she treats a dying woman.(n)

programme.title: Providence
programme.desc: Syd's first shift working at a prison proves to be a shocking experience.(n)

programme.title: To Sir, with Love
programme.desc: A black engineer takes a teaching job at a tough London school to make ends meet, and over the course of his difficult first term, struggles to gain the respect of his disruptive pupils. Drama, starring Sidney Poitier, Christian Roberts, Judy Geeson, Geoffrey Bayldon, Patricia Routledge, Christopher Chittell and Lulu.(n)

programme.title: To Sir, with Love 2
programme.desc: After 30 years teaching in London, Mark Thackeray retires and returns to his home town of Chicago. However, the sight of a deprived school inspires him to return to duty and make a difference in the lives of more struggling students. Drama sequel, starring Sidney Poitier and Daniel J Travanti.(n)

programme.title: The Winds of War
programme.desc: Part one of two. Drama documenting the early years of the Second World War. A US Naval officer makes a journey to Nazi Germany to take up a job at the embassy. With Robert Mitchum.(n)

programme.title: The Way We Were
programme.desc: Upper-class novelist Hubbell Gardiner and Jewish political activist Katie Morosky meet at college in the 1930s and later marry. Although very much in love, their opposing political outlooks lead to conflict when Hubbell's successful career as a Hollywood screenwriter is compromised by his wife's socialist leanings. As the 1950s dawn it becomes clear their differences are too great to overcome. Romantic drama, with Robert Redford, Barbra Streisand, Bradford Dillman and Murray Hamilton.(n)

programme.title: The Way We Were
programme.desc: Upper-class novelist Hubbell Gardiner and Jewish political activist Katie Morosky meet at college in the 1930s and later marry. programme.title: Man of the World
programme.desc: As Mike Pompeo's nomination for Secretary of State clears a Senate hurdle, official visits from French President Emmanuel Macron and German Chancellor Angela Merkel command the administration's attention. John Heilemann and Mark McKinnon sit down with Wendy Sherman, lead negotiator behind the Iran nuclear deal. Plus, Alex Wagner interviews imam Dr. Ismail Elshikh, the plaintiff behind the travel-ban challenge.

programme.title: The Sense of an Ending
programme.desc: Tony Webster (Jim Broadbent) lives a reclusive existence in London, until he learns that a diary has been left to him by the recently deceased mother (Emily Mortimer) of an ex-girlfriend (Charlotte Rampling). As Webster investigates the diary, he is forced to face the truth about his first love and the consequences of decisions made a lifetime ago, while attempting to resolve his strained relationships with his ex-wife (Harriet Walter) and their pregnant daughter (Michelle Dockery).

programme.title: Texas Rangers
programme.desc: A ragtag group of youngsters band together after the American Civil War to form the Texas Rangers, a group charged with the duty of cleaning up the West.

programme.title: The Bye Bye Man
programme.desc: Elliot, his girlfriend Sasha, and their friend John move into an old house off campus for their last year in college. Almost immediately, Sasha begins to suspect there is something wrong with the home, and enlists her clairvoyant friend Kim to hold a séance. Prompted by a clue in the house, they attract the attention of The Bye Bye Man, an insidious supernatural figure who deceives and preys upon his victims before causing them to turn on those around them.

programme.title: The Whole Nine Yards
programme.desc: Oz (Matthew Perry) is a miserable dentist living with Sophie (Rosanna Arquette), his shrew of a wife. Things get even worse when hitman Jimmy "The Tulip" (Bruce Willis) moves in next door. Sent by Sophie to Chicago to rat out Jimmy to the Gogalak gang, Oz meets and falls in love with Cynthia (Natasha Henstridge), Jimmy's estranged wife. Oz returns home only to discover Sophie's hired Jill (Amanda Peet), his perky dental hygienist, to kill him.

programme.title: Drugstore Cowboy
programme.desc: Without adopting the romantic and moralistic cliches that have crippled many other films about addiction, Gus Van Sant directs Matt Dillon, Kelly Lynch, James Le Gros and Heather Graham in one of the most influential films of the late 1980s. Bob (Dillon) is the leader of a small gang of junkies that robs pharmacies and hospitals for prescription drugs. Alas, Bob is now starting to feel the burden of responsibility as he watches over his band of misfits. Van Sant's joyous and exhilarating second feature is notable for its humor and bravery.

programme.title: New Wave: Dare to be Different
programme.desc: In August, 1982, a small group of radio visionaries at WLIR Long Island knew they couldn't compete with the mega radio stations in New York City. With one brave decision, they changed the sound of radio forever. Program Director Denis McNamara, the crew at the station and the biggest artists of the era tell the story of how they battled the FCC, the record labels, mega-radio and all the conventional rules to create a musical movement that brought the New Wave to America - including bands like U2, Talking Heads, Depeche Mode and Blondie.

programme.title: Personal Shopper
programme.desc: By day, American in Paris Maureen (Kristen Stewart) works as a personal shopper, motor-biking around the city buying up deluxe couture for a celebrity client. By night, she attempts to channel the spirits of the dead, hoping to make contact with her recently deceased twin brother. When Maureen begins receiving a series of chilling, increasingly sinister text messages, it seems she may have made contact - but she doesn't know with whom.

programme.title: The Bye Bye Man
programme.desc: Elliot, his girlfriend Sasha, and their friend John move into an old house off campus for their last year in college. Almost immediately, Sasha begins to suspect there is something wrong with the home, and enlists her clairvoyant friend Kim to hold a séance. Prompted by a clue in the house, they attract the attention of The Bye Bye Man, an insidious supernatural figure who deceives and preys upon his victims before causing them to turn on those around them.

programme.title: Sleepless
programme.desc: When Las Vegas cop Vincent Downs (Jamie Foxx) and his partner Sean (Tip "T.I." Harris) rob a cocaine shipment bound for a drug-dealing casino boss (Dermot Mulroney), the desperate businessman retaliates by kidnapping Vincent's son (Octavius J. Johnson). Pursued by a dogged Internal Affairs investigator (Michelle Monaghan) and a sadistic drug kingpin (Scoot McNairy), Vincent must rely on his street smarts and sheer force of will as he tries to rescue his child over the course of a single night. Directed by Baran bo Odar.

Harris) rob a cocaine shipment bound for a drug-dealing casino boss (Dermot Mulroney), the desperate businessman retaliates by kidnapping Vincent's son (Octavius J. Johnson). Directed by Baran bo Odar.

programme.title: Eddie Griffin: Undeniable
programme.desc: This comedy special is Griffin's magnum opus about the world, relationships and humanity as a whole. He celebrates his 30-year anniversary in comedy by being on stage and pulling laughter from his fans during the live taping.

programme.title: Word is Bond
programme.desc: This documentary ﬁlm by Sacha Jenkins examines the transformative power of lyrics in the world of hip-hop music. What was born on the streets of the South Bronx has now taken root globally and the young poets of New York have helped to spawn regional dialects everywhere. Through dynamic archival footage, in-depth interviews and excursions with artists like Nas, Tech9, J Cole, Rapsody and Anderson. Paak, the film explores the many dimensions that hip-hop poetics occupy.

programme.title: New Wave: Dare to be Different
programme.desc: In August, 1982, a small group of radio visionaries at WLIR Long Island knew they couldn't compete with the mega radio stations in New York City. With one brave decision, they changed the sound of radio forever. Program Director Denis McNamara, the crew at the station and the biggest artists of the era tell the story of how they battled the FCC, the record labels, mega-radio and all the conventional rules to create a musical movement that brought the New Wave to America - including bands like U2, Talking Heads, Depeche Mode and Blondie.

programme.title: Certain Women
programme.desc: Michelle Williams, Kristen Stewart and Laura Dern star as three women striving to forge their own paths amidst the wide-open plains of the American Northwest. The lawyer (Dern) finds herself contending with both office sexism and a hostage situation. The wife and mother (Williams) has determination to build her dream home which puts her at odds with the men in her life. The young law student (Stewart) forms an ambiguous bond with a lonely ranch hand (Lily Gladstone).

programme.title: Zero Days
programme.desc: Documentary from Oscar-winning filmmaker Alex Gibney that explores the phenomenon of Stuxnet, a self-replicating computer virus discovered in 2010 that was allegedly commissioned by the US and Israeli governments to sabotage Iran's nuclear program that opened up a Pandora's box of cyber warfare.

programme.title: Lord of War
programme.desc: Nicolas Cage stars in this drama thriller as Yuri Orlov, a Russian immigrant who becomes a millionaire in the Eighties and Nineties by reselling weapons from his politically crumbling homeland to "hot spot" regions around the world, all while marrying a beautiful woman (Bridget Moynahan), dodging a determined federal agent (Ethan Hawke), and occasionally facing the immorality of his chosen profession. Jared Leto and Ian Holm costar in this film from writer/director Andrew Niccol ("Gattaca," "The Truman Show").

programme.title: End of Days
programme.desc: It's three days to the millennium and Satan (Gabriel Byrne) has come to New York looking for a bride. Arnold Schwarzenegger plays a down on his luck alcoholic cop who must protect the woman (Robin Tunney) that Satan picks.

programme.title: Kill Bill: Vol. 1
programme.desc: A woman emerges from a coma four years after taking a bullet to the head at her own wedding, and goes on an epic vendetta against her former boss and his deadly squad of international assassins in a kill or be-killed fight. Directed by Quentin Tarantino; stars Uma Thurman and Lucy Liu.

programme.title: Mona Lisa Smile
programme.desc: In 1953, a time when women's roles are rigidly defined, novice art history professor Katherine Watson begins teaching at the prestigious all-female Wellesley College, which despite its academic reputation, is an environment where success is measured by how well the students marry. Encouraging these women to strive for a more enlightened future, Watson challenges the administration and inspires her students to look beyond the image of what is, and consider the possibilities of what could be.

programme.title: Open Water
programme.desc: Loosely inspired by a shocking true story, this chilling psychological horror story follows a bickering couple on vacation in the Caribbean who are accidentally abandoned during a diving expedition and forced to fend for themselves in the ocean as they are surrounded by sharks - while the tour operators back at the harbor take 24 hours to realize that they have left a pair of customers stranded. Blanchard Ryan and Daniel Travis star in this gripping independent hit from writer/director Chris Kentis.

programme.title: Frank's Northern Southern Express
programme.desc: Frank starts a booming import-export business. Fiona considers moving into her own place after Ford shows her a side of Chicago she's never seen. Meanwhile, Lip interviews new sponsors, Ian confronts a pastor trying to "pray the gay away" and Debbie deals with being unemployed while looking for a way to afford school and raise Franny.(n)

programme.title: Paean To The People
programme.desc: Carrie and Saul's mission doesn't go as planned. Elizabeth Keane fights for her presidency. Season finale.(n)

programme.title: The Third Ortolan
programme.desc: Axe tracks down a critical piece of evidence that could destroy him. Both Axe and Chuck reckon with just how far they're willing to go to protect Wendy. The Ice Juice case comes to a head when a judge gives Connerty a difficult deadline.(n)

programme.title: Man of the World
